DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study investigate whether pelvic floor muscle train cough-suppression therapy reduce symptom urinary incontinence amongst woman chronic obstructive pulmonary disease grade 1-4 ( mild severe disease ) .
DOC.brief_title: Urinary Incontinence Amongst Women With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
DOC.detailed_description: This two-centre study consist randomise control trial ( RCT ) parallel group design include two intervention group one control group . Recruitment data collection occur simultaneously Ã˜HT St. Olav 's Hospital Trondheim . All participant complete initial four week general group exercise class ( 1 hour week ) prior randomisation . This intervention focus strength exercise ( low limb upper limb ) , endurance training , balance training thorax mobilising exercise . All participant examine complete questionnaire two occasion ; initial four week general exercise/before intervention , 16 week post-randomisation . Participants randomise either Intervention group A ( pelvic floor muscle train group ) , Intervention group B ( cough-suppression group ) control group receive brief write information pelvic floor muscle train cough-suppression , form regular follow-up intervention throughout intervention period .
